section.title: Quota Manager
section.para: Quota manager is designed to provide the ability to manage qoutas of eXo jcr entities, which can be very useful for administration purposes. In general the major features are:

listitem.para: Getting the size and setting the qouta of a node, workspace, repository, JCR instance etc.
Setting the behavior on exceeding the quota.
Getting the size of the Lucene index (per workspace and total).

section.title: Quota Manager configuration
section.para: To use Quota Manager along with Infinispan you need to configure it. An example of the configuration:

listitem.para: exceeded-quota-behaviour — defines the behaviour of quota manager on exceeding the limits. Can be warning or exception. Default value is warning.
cache-configuration — in this section you can define explicitly the infinispan parameters:
infinispan-cl-cache.jdbc.datasource — mandatory property
infinispan-configuration — mandatory property
jgroups-configuration — mandatory property
infinispan-cl-cache.jdbc.connectionFactory — dafault value — org.infinispan.loaders.jdbc.connectionfactory.ManagedConnectionFactory
infinispan-cluster-name — dafault value — JCR-cluster-quota
infinispan-cl-cache.jdbc.table.name — dafault value — jcr
infinispan-cl-cache.jdbc.table.create — dafault value — true
infinispan-cl-cache.jdbc.table.drop — dafault value — false
infinispan-cl-cache.jdbc.data.type — dafault value — auto
infinispan-cl-cache.jdbc.data.column — dafault value — data
infinispan-cl-cache.jdbc.id.type — dafault value — auto
infinispan-cl-cache.jdbc.id.column — dafault value — id
infinispan-cl-cache.jdbc.timestamp.type — dafault value — auto
infinispan-cl-cache.jdbc.timestamp.column — dafault value — timestamp

section.title: Quota manager interface overview
section.para: Quota manager interface declares the following methods:

listitem.para: getNodeDataSize(String repositoryName, String workspaceName, String nodePath) — returns the size of a Node. The size of a node is the length of its content, if a node has child nodes — the size is the sum of all child nodes sizes + size of the current node.

getNodeQuota(String repositoryName, String workspaceName, String nodePath) — returns the node's quota limit, the maximum allowed node data size of this node. First will be tried to check if quota limit was explicitly set for this path. Otherwise will be tried to find pattern quota that matches for defined node path.

setNodeQuota(String repositoryName, String workspaceName, String nodePath, long quotaLimit, boolean asyncUpdate) — sets the quota of a Node. For asyncUpdate parameter: true means checking if node exceeds quota limit will be performed asynchronously, i.e. for some period of time difference between new and old content size will be accumulated and only then send for validation.
removeNodeQuota(String repositoryName, String workspaceName, String nodePath) — removes the node's quota limit, the maximum allowed node data size of this node.

setGroupOfNodesQuota(String repositoryName, String workspaceName, String patternPath, long quotaLimit, boolean asyncUpdate) — sets the quota of the group of Nodes. This method will set one quota value for many nodes. For patternPath parameter: the pattern indicates bunch of nodes, allowed * as any node name in a path and % as any character in name.
removeGroupOfNodesQuota(String repositoryName, String workspaceName, String patternPath) — removes the node's quota limit for a bunch of nodes at the same time.
getWorkspaceDataSize(String repositoryName, String workspaceName) — returns the size of a Workspace. The size of a workspace is the size of all nodes, stored in it.
getWorkspaceQuota(String repositoryName, String workspaceName) — returns the quota of a Workspace. The quota of a workspace is a maximum allowed size of the workspace.
setWorkspaceQuota(String repositoryName, String workspaceName, long quotaLimit) — set the quota of a Workspace. The quota of a workspace is the maximum allowed size of the workspace.
removeWorkspaceQuota(String repositoryName, String workspaceName) — removes the workspace's quota limit, the maximum allowed workspace data size.

getWorkspaceIndexSize(String repositoryName, String workspaceName) — gets the size of a Workspace's Lucene index. The size of a workspace's Lucene is the size of the Lucene index directory in file system.
getRepositoryDataSize(String repositoryName) — returns the size of a Repository. The size of a repository is the sum of sizes of all workspaces stored in it.
getRepositoryQuota(String repositoryName) — returns the quota of a Repository. The quota of a repository is a maximum allowed size of the repository.
setRepositoryQuota(String repositoryName, long quotaLimit) — sets the quota of a Repository. The quota of a repository is a maximum allowed size of the repository.
removeRepositoryQuota(String repositoryName) — Removes a repository quota limit, a maximum allowed repository data size.
getRepositoryIndexSize(String repositoryName) — gets the size of a Repository's Lucene index. The size of a repository's Lucene is the sum of sizes of all workspaces Lucene indexes sizes.
getGlobalDataSize() — returns the size of the whole JCR instance. The size of a jcr is the sum of sizes of all repositories stored in it.
getGlobalQuota() — returns the quota of the whole JCR instance. The quota of a jcr is a maximum allowed size of the jcr.
setGlobalQuota(long quotaLimit) — sets the quota of the whole JCR instance. The quota of a jcr is a maximum allowed size of the jcr.
removeGlobalQuota() — Removes global quota limit, a maximum allowed global data size.
getGlobalIndexSize() — gets the size of the whole JCR instance's Lucene index. The size of a jcr's Lucene is the sum of sizes of all repositories Lucene indexes sizes.

note.para: All mentioned methods are available via JMX technology.
